description: A short lesson to help you apply Do Things That Don't Scaleâ€”Then Stop.

hook.text: Paul Graham told Airbnb's founders to go door-to-door taking photos. It couldn't scale. That was the point.

buildup.text: Early on, unscalable tactics build love. Hand-written notes, personal onboarding, custom features.

discovery.text: These tactics teach you what customers truly valueâ€”so you can automate the right things later.

twist.text: The mistake is doing unscalable things forever. At some point, every founder must let go and systematize.

climax.text: Stripe's founders installed their API on users' laptops in person. Once they understood the friction, they automated it.

punchline.text: Learn by hand. Then build the machine.

quiz.question: Why did Paul Graham advise startups to 'do things that don't scale'?
options: To save money by avoiding automation costs
To deeply understand customer needs before systematizing
To impress investors with hustle and dedication
